newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Packer has online deal with Microsoft.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Packer has online deal with Microsoft.

text.p: Kerry Packer's Publishing and Broadcasting Ltd (PBL) said on Friday that it had formed an online joint venture with Microsoft Corp which would include PBL products and Microsoft's MSN service.
PBL, which owns the leading Nine television network as well as a string of magazines, said the Australian online product would be launched in the next two to four months.
The product would include news, sport, weather as well as entertainment and lifestyle shows. Online users would also have access to retailing and financial services, PBL said.

Any future online Microsoft products would be part of the joint venture while its current products such as The Microsoft Network (MSN), the entertainment guide Sidewalk, travel services-based Expedia, and financial product Investor would be part of the new group.

MSN International director Alan McGinnis said MSN membership in Australia was expected to reach 75,000 by July 1 this year, with local subscriber numbers increasing faster on a per capita basis than any other MSN affiliate.
McGinnis said there was a huge marketing opportunity in Australia due to the high penetration of personal computers and the trend for Australians to be early adopters of technology.

The board of the joint venture would be chaired by PBL Online chairman Daniel Petrie and include two Microsoft officials Laura Jennings and John Nielsen. Financial terms were not disclosed. -- Sydney Newsroom 61-2 9373-1800
